definition: simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Did you study standard or simplified Characters?
sentences.chinese: 所學是正體字或簡體字？

sentences.english: A summation of the kinds of differences found between traditional characters and their simplified versions.
sentences.chinese: 爲繁體字和簡體字之間的諸多不同之處作一綜述。

sentences.english: We should have a mastery of the advantages and disadvantages of both complex Chinese characters and simplified Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 漢字繁體字和簡體字，從不同的角度看，各有優缺點。

sentences.english: And they pride themselves in not using the simplified version.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲自己沒有使用簡體字而感到自豪。

sentences.english: Simplified Chinese characters from Oracle to the evolutionary history of a continuous and verifiable.
sentences.chinese: 簡體字來自於連續可證明的甲骨文的進化史。

sentences.english: The simplified characters are too rough to express the Artistic qualities of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 簡體字過於粗糙無法表達漢字形意的美感。
